paragraphs.paragraph_1: I'm a junior frontend developer with two years of non-commercial experience.
paragraphs.paragraph_2: In March 2022 I've successfully completed the
paragraphs.paragraph_3: I'm looking for a job opportunity to join my interests with business environment.
paragraphs.paragraph_4: I would like to work on improving Web solutions for better user experience. This is why:
paragraphs.notice: *Dare IT supports women in starting and developing their career in the IT industry

listItems: I learn best practices to keep my code clean and maintainable
I like simple structures and components easy to test

experience.title: Frontend Mentee in Dare IT Mentoring Program
experience.subtitle: (Dare IT)
details: Acquired essential hard & soft skills for a Junior Frontend Developer position;

experience.title: Administrative assistant in EU projects office
experience.subtitle: (FALCO)
details: Managed project execution – assured timely phases closure;

experience.title: HR Specialist (Internal trainer & Communication assistant & HRM system tester)
experience.subtitle: (HUSQVARNA Poland Sp. z o.o.)
details: Accomplished international User Acceptance Test for the new HRM platform – tested scenarios, data flow and functionalities correctness (role: tester);
Contributed to HRM system implementation process – translated content to Polish, reported on technical problems;
Wrote good quality instructions and user guides;
Communicated with international HR teams on a regular basis – role: local leader in HR remote projects and decision-making;

experience.title: EU projects assistant & coordinator, Trainings management specialist
experience.subtitle: (Wektor Consulting; “LIFE” Szkolenia)
details: Worked in a distributed team: managed remotely a group of trainers in a regional project;
Cooperated with customers to meet their expectations on training & consultancy services;

courses.title: Bootcamp Web Developer Plus - a course run by Codemy S.A., Wrocław
details: 37 weekly modules + 9 weeks of individual work on 3 training projects designed to use acquired skills;
Individual weekly video meetings: 1-on-1 with supporting experienced developer;
Content: frontend and backend technologies (see: Technical skills section);
Individual project: building an administration panel view (and subpages);
Team project: developing online furniture store (and subpages) – Tasks: modify elements behavior, add functionality/images, RWD. Worked on JIRA, Github. Technologies: React.js, React Router, Redux;

courses.title: Web Pages & Web Application Design and Development, Databases Build & Administration – foundations
details: a course (440h) in frames of Adult vocational training (profession code: 351103) - state examination and certificate;

inspirations.label: Books
inspirations.description: While learning programming, I have been using a great variety of resources. Below I put my favorite ones, where I get much knowledge from. At the beginning I got some information on a developer job and career from Polish software engineer’s book: Maciej Aniserowicz 'Zawód: Programista'. Other books that I currently work with are:
details: Flavio Copes - 'JavaScript from ES5 to ESNext'
Flavio Copes - 'The React Handbook'
Robin Wieruch - 'The Road to learn React'
Robin Wieruch - 'Taming state in React'
Kirupa Chinnathambi - 'Learning React'
Jeff Sutherland - 'Scrum'
